column4: trying to install ubuntu onto a partition which already has it installed - - getting error no root volume...?
have formatted as ext3...
how do i make ubuntu install choose that partition as the correct one?
didnt ubuntu let you choose? it wasnt automatic for me... in the partition manager i had to flag each partition as what it should be used for
i'm trying to do that too
how did you specify which partition is the root one?
and it isnt letting you choose? i had a "special" computer XD i have 5 partitions.....
lol ok - i only have 3
did you open the partition manager from the install cd?
yes
0.o if only i remembered what it looked like lol
lol k
tryng to remember it was about 2 weeks ago ><
should i say - ex3 journaling file system?
what do you see on the partition screen, are you there now?
yes
oh are you askign what TO use?
eh?
i use reiser 0.o i was goign to do reiser4 cause when i used to use linux peopel were excited about it but i guess it never hit off and no one supports...... so i kinda oopsed and ment to run ext3
ide use ext3 on your root
right
that or reiserFS, reiser is faster out of hte box. but over time it getes cluttered and slows down a bit
